title: I want to publish a novel with my own illustrations. Do I submit my manuscript with my drawings? - Quora

response.answer_text: You need not submit your novel complete together with all its illustrations, if your novel is planned you shoul no it’s beginning, middle and end. So submit one chapter of each together with their illustrations. The publishing house has many manuscripts sent to them and really doesn’t have the time to read them from cover to cover. Doing it in the way I suggested means (a) you can wet their appetite for more, (b) they can see if the novel reads consistently (c) the manuscript can be quickly read (d) if it’s not up th scratch then it can save you days, week, even months of hard work
Chances of an agent or novel publisher being interested will drop to about nil. Graphic novel?
